paragraphs.name: c9fc
paragraphs.text: Unlike today’s LD/plant-dominated world, in this world there’s a lot less reason to move to a particular place for work. This doesn’t just reverse the primary impetus of the major migrations of the 1930’s; it may have significant effects on transnational migrations, at least ones for economic reasons. If people are fleeing poverty, and their homes still have reliable access to food, shelter, and security, then landing a relatively small amount of infrastructure can then effectively connect them to a global economy.

c9c394c49d5.title: I fully agree with your thoughts.

paragraphs.name: 2e4e
paragraphs.text: I fully agree with your thoughts. I work as a data analyst with an IT help desk, and at my location, the technicians only answer emails. We could easily telecommute, and do have one day a week where we can telecommute. The only thing stopping us from having more days or telecommuting full time is an older manager who likes coming into the office and…

paragraphs.name: a6b5
paragraphs.text: Two interrelated topics I’d volunteer: 1) Hierarchical team structure won’t adopt telecommuting until managers relinquish the 19th century tradition of never trusting their employees. 2) Some people cannot get their information points across without “being there”.

76a6b628c366.title: Don’t think “shared whiteboard”, think “shared drawing space”.

paragraphs.name: 6d98
paragraphs.text: Don’t think “shared whiteboard”, think “shared drawing space”. (It may still get called a whiteboard for marketing purposes but it won’t use an actual whiteboard.) c83a5d3d19a0.title: Thank you for sharing your ideas.

paragraphs.name: cd37
paragraphs.text: Thank you for sharing your ideas. I work in consulting (and have for many years) — and my only comment is I think your estimates are a bit extended. If you would shave 5–10 years off your lower ends and 10–15 years off the higher end — I think you are heading in the right direction. If you look at the big 4 consulting companies — which represent a…

33f8d1b5c096.title: Sales calls of the sort you’re describing tend to happen only for small storefront businesses.

paragraphs.name: 1f96
paragraphs.text: Sales calls of the sort you’re describing tend to happen only for small storefront businesses. When sales are happening to large companies, or even medium ones, it starts with telephone calls, e-mails, 1:1 meetings and conversations, ultimately larger presentation meetings, more 1:1’s, phone calls, and so on. All things which work just fine remotely — and frequently do.

content.subtitle: That will probably interact in unexpected ways. I could see some areas in which LD is highly prized, for reducing a carbon/impact footprint…

paragraphs.text: Already gave a reflexive response back on G+, but more in depth here is interesting. Here’s one question, though, and that’s one of sustainability. I’m not sure how far flung people can actually practically locate themselves. Wherever you are living, you still need food, water, shelter and so on. Even if you’re working with people all over the world…

beeb58fe0912.title: You do not mention remotely operated machines.

paragraphs.name: 939b
paragraphs.text: You do not mention remotely operated machines. This will turn more LD jobs into LI. The military with their drones is today’s prime example, but many sectors will follow. Take home care, in The Netherlands a main reason for the exploding costs of healthcare. Instead of nurses driving from home to home to perform simple tasks for elderly and…
